byline.contributor: Peter Baker reported from Columbia, and Julie Hirschfeld Davis from Washington.
byline.original: By PETER BAKER and JULIE HIRSCHFELD DAVIS

abstract: Pres Obama, during speech at historically black Benedict College in South Carolina, recalls courage of protesters in Selma, Ala, 50 years ago, and urges persistence on race relations.
lead_paragraph: The president, speaking at a historically black school in Columbia, S.C., said that Ferguson was “not just a one-time thing.” He also spoke of the courage of protesters in Selma, Ala., 50 years ago.

headline.main: Urging Persistence on Racial Gains, Obama Recalls Sacrifice in Selma
headline.print_headline: Urging Persistence on Racial Gains, Obama Recalls Sacrifice in Selma

snippet: The president, speaking at a historically black school in Columbia, S.C., said that Ferguson was “not just a one-time thing.” He also spoke of the courage of protesters in Selma, Ala., 50 years ago.
